person.persName: Lafayette Wells (Henry and Shelby County, Kentucky, machinist, depot keeper, and soldier.)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, machinist, farmer, and soldier. Montgomery County, Kentucky, native. Married to Sallie M. Lyle Wells in Shelby County, Kentucky, on November 14, 1858. Father of Mary Lucinda Wells, Joshua Wells, and John Wells. Machinist in Henry County in 1860. Served in the Eighth Kentucky Regiment Cavalry (C.S.A.) as a sergeant from September 10, 1862, to March 14, 1863. Taken prisoner at Mount Sterling, Kentucky, on February 26, 1863. Signed a loyalty oath to the U.S. government on March 14, 1863. Farmer in Henry County in 1863.
